intro: Tithymalus alpigena, commonly known as the alpine tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a subtle fragrance. Tithymalus alpigena is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
